hints.content:
We know the $\blueD{\text{number of groups}}$:

There are $\blueD{6}$ pitchers.

And we know the $\purpleC{\text{size of the groups}}$:

Ben uses $\purpleC9$ lemons to make a pitcher of lemonade.

The product will tell us the $\greenD{\text{total}}$.

In this problem, the $\greenD{\text{total}}$ is the $\greenD{\text{total number of lemons used}}$.
The product tells us the $\greenD{\text{total number of lemons used}}$.

question.content:
Ben uses $9$ lemons to make a pitcher of lemonade. There are $6$ pitchers of lemonade.

**What does the expression $6\times9$ represent?**

choices.content: Total number of glasses of lemonades
